PathNotFound.description: To be used if the path is invalid, i.e. the requested resource is not available. Note: Unsupported endpoints MUST use code 501.

FeatureUnsupported.description: The back-end responds with this error code whenever an endpoint is specified in the openEO API, but is not supported.

ServiceUnavailable.message: Service not available at the moment.

StorageFailure.description: Server couldn't store file due to server-side reasons.

StorageQuotaExceeded.description: The storage quota has been exceeded by the user.

FileTypeInvalid.description: File format, file extension or mime type is not allowed.

FileSizeExceeded.description: File exceeds allowed maximum file size.

FileContentInvalid.description: The content of the file is invalid.

FileLocked.description: The file is locked by a running job or another process.

ArrayTypesInconsistent.message: The array [{value}] contains values of multiple types.

ProcessArgumentInvalid.message: Invalid value '{value}' for the process argument '{argument}' specified.

FormatArgumentUnsupported.message: Output format argument '{argument}' is not supported.

FormatArgumentInvalid.message: Invalid value '{value}' for the output format argument '{argument}' specified.

FormatUnsuitable.message: Data can't be transformed into the requested output format.

JobLocked.description: The job is currently locked due to an enabled service or a running batch computation and can't be modified meanwhile.

ProcessingNotFinished.description: The job has not finished computing the results yet. Try again later.
ProcessingNotFinished.message: Result processing has not finished yet.

AuthorizationRequired.description: The back-end responds with this error code whenever the HTTP status code 401 is appropriate (see above) and no other openEO error code in the 4000 range is suitable.

PaymentRequired.description: The budget required to fulfil the request are insufficient.

PermissionsInsufficient.description: The back-end responds with this error code whenever the HTTP status code 403 is appropriate (see above) and no other openEO error code in the 4000 range is suitable.

PasswordInsecure.description: The specified password is not considered secure by the policy of the back-end provider or no password was given at all. The user needs to specify a different password to proceed.
PasswordInsecure.message: Password does not meet the requirements.

ServiceArgumentInvalid.message: Invalid value '{value}' for the service argument '{argument}' specified.
